info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN PITTSYLVANIA...SOUTH CENTRAL BEDFORD...NORTHEASTERN HENRY AND SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF MARTINSVILLE THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sontag, or near Sydnorsville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Martinsville... Chatham... Gretna... Axton... Penhook... Blairs... and Callands. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
